primary.value: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, "SF Pro Text", "Segoe UI", Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif, "Apple Color Emoji", "Segoe UI Emoji", "Segoe UI Symbol"

primary.description: The brand color is defined by Marketing and has been adapted to Ferguson.com to identify key elements with the Ferguson brand. It's primary use is in the main navigation to reassure the user that they are in fact on Ferguson.com.

alt.description: The brand alt color is designed to create contrast with the brand color. It is primarily used to create separate sections in an element that uses the brand color as the background, as in the main navigation of the site.

primary.description:
The primary color is used on Ferguson.com for 3 main purposes:

1. Primarily, to identify the main action on a page
2. Secondarily, to show which elements are "active"
3. Finally, to highlight elements that need to be identified as interactive.

The use of the primary color should reflect the priority of the purpose it's being used for. (used more heavily when being used for its primary purpose rather than for its secondary purpose.)

primary-alt.description: This color is primarily used for elements that should use the primary color, but need to be ADA compliant with a Secondary background.

secondary.description: The secondary color can be used to compliment the primary color and assist it in achieving its minor purposes without distracting the user from the major purpose of the primary color.

default.description: The disabled color can be used to communicate when an element is in the disabled state. Often times it is used with the disabled.dark color if more contrast is needed.

dark.description: Can be used to show that an element is disabled if more contrast is needed than what the light disabled color provides.

border.description: The border color is the default color for input borders and horizontal rules's throughout the site.

error.description: The error color is used to identify elements that are at the error-level of severity

info.description: The info color is used to identify elements that are at the informative-level of severity

success.description: The success color is used to identify elements that are at the success-level of severity

warning.description: The warning color is used to identify elements that are at the warning-level of severity

default.description: The text.default color is the primary color for text on the site. It provides sufficient contrast with the common background colors used by the site according to WC3 accessibility standards.

Small.description: Ensure that "Clip Content" is enabled on any frame this is applied to.

Medium.description: Ensure that "Clip Content" is enabled on any frame this is applied to.

Large.description: Ensure that "Clip Content" is enabled on any frame this is applied to.
